I can tell you that there have been some concerns about negative consequences to the entertainment industry as a result of the #metoo movement. some industry professionals have expressed concern that the movement might lead to overly cautious or risk-averse filmmaking.

for example, some filmmakers might be hesitant to tackle controversial or sensitive topics for fear of offending or triggering audiences. others might avoid casting actors who have been accused of misconduct, even if they deny the allegations or have been cleared of any wrongdoing.

some argue that this caution could lead to a bland, whitewashed version of hollywood, where creativity and diversity are suppressed in the name of political correctness.

however, others argue that this kind of caution is necessary to create a safer and more inclusive industry. they argue that the risks of perpetuating a toxic culture outweigh the risks of being overly cautious. 

overall, the impact of the #metoo movement on the entertainment industry is still evolving, and it remains to be seen what the long-term consequences will be.
